page.title: 02The Toll Cottage in Williton
page.content: We went to look at an{old cottage}that was being repaired. When we were there we saw an{old window that went {down to the ground.} In the olden days the cottage was a{Toll Cottage. } The{toll keeper}used to sit by the window and watch for people to come by. When some one came along he would come out of the cottage and put the barrier down. Then he would ask them for the toll and the toll keeper let them by. It was a small cottage and the window that the toll keeper sat by had an iron bar down the middle of it to stop burglars coming in. The cottage was made of{stone. } {Builders uncovered the window}when they were taking the plaster off. There was another{small window}that the toll keeper used. He let down a bucket when he was in bed so that people put their toll in it.
